text: Salhad is one of the 51 Union Councils (sub-divisions) of Abbottabad District in the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province of Pakistan. The Union Council of Salhad is named after what was the main village of the area, but today has become a part of Abbottabad city. ==People== The population of the town is now over 21,000. ==Subdivisions== Salhad Union Council is subdivided into two areas Salhad and Khokar. ==References== Category:Union councils of Abbottabad District
title: Salhad
